subject: Re: [junit] ClassCastException with JAXB object
msgSnippet: I would go with Bretts Theory here. The same class loaded with two different class-loaders although identical (loaded from the same file) are not considered
messageBody:
I would go with Bretts Theory here. The same class loaded with two different
class-loaders although identical (loaded from the same file) are not
considered the same in the JVM.
Having been bitten by this more than once I have respect for classloaders :)

Good luck!
/J

On 6/29/06, Brett L. Schuchert <schuchert@...> wrote:
>
> I wonder if there's any chance that those classes are being reloaded by
> the JUnit classloader...
>
> Have a look here on how to fix that:
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_9
>
> You will find the excluded.properties in the JUnit jar and patch it.
>
> FWIW, if you use 7-zip, http://7-zip.org/, you can open the file, find
> excluded.properties and edit it in place rather than having to extract the
> jar, edit the file and re-create the jar using either winzip or jar.
>
> I'm not affiliated with 7-zip, I just use it.
>
> Tutorials and Articles
> http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/
